Package io.github.teamdonut.proj.common

Class Board

java.lang.Object
io.github.teamdonut.proj.common.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Board is a data-only class that holds a 2-dimensional array representing the current state of a tic tac toe match.
Author:
Grant Goldsworth

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    int BOARD_COLUMNS  
    int BOARD_ROWS  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    Constructs a Board object by setting all values of Token[][] board to BLANK.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()

  • Method Details

    • getUnderlyingBoard

      public Token[][] getUnderlyingBoard()
      Gets the current Token[][] board of a Board object.
      Returns:
      the Token[][] board of a Board object

    • updateToken

      public void updateToken​(int col, int row, Token c)
      After checking to make sure the passed in position is within the board, the method updates a token of Token[][] board.

      NOTE: This method uses x for column and y for row as per compatibility with JFX's grid pane management.

      Parameters:
      col - the x-value for the token in the array [0, 1, 2]
      row - the y-value for the token in the array [0, 1, 2]
      c - the token for the array [X, O]

    • getToken

      public Token getToken​(int col, int row)
      Returns the token of a specific position in Token[][] board.

      NOTE: This method uses x for column and y for row as per compatibility with JFX's grid pane management.

      Parameters:
      col - the x-value for the token in the array [0, 1, 2]
      row - the y-value for the token in the array [0, 1, 2]
      Returns:
      The token [X, O, BLANK] of a specific position in Token[][] board.

    • isBoardFull

      public boolean isBoardFull()
      Checks to see if the board is full or not (all cells have a token that is not the character ' ').
      Returns:
      true if all cells have a value besides BLANK, false otherwise

    • clearBoard

      public void clearBoard()
      Sets all values within Token[][] board to BLANK.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Checks whether or not a Board object has the same size and state as another Board object.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
